job_title: Proactive Service Delivery Engineer in Raleigh, NC
pros: Stability, Healthcare, 401k, and reputation.
cons:
No advancement.

Review are annual cost of living raises happen never. I went 6 year with great reviews from peers and customers without a single raise. So that is year over year pay cuts.

They clawed back ever benefit, they even demanded you work from home and took back your internet expense....

Money for raises are distributed to you manager, who then can allocate that amount to anybody, with or without merit. So sucking up to the boss is the only way to go. 

The hate their staff a bit more than they hate their customers.

Besides offering no career path they practice ageism, after 20 years of service at 59 years of age I was laid off by HR , with no notice to my manager or the 2 managers above him.

Working with people who's morals are in disagreement with your own is soul sucking. I'm sorry I stayed so long.

pros:
- good place to start Software Sales Career
- Pretty great benefits: low cost healthcare, 401k match, Employee stock program (for purchase), etc...
cons:
- Non-competitive pay. I recently have been interviewing other places, and every single one offers a higher base. 
- Boys Club. Not many women make it to Corporate or Senior Account Executive roles. Almost all leadership is men, and they play hard favorites.
- Unattainable quotas. Quota is pretty much a joke in our vertical. I have not hit quota once in my 3 years, and I am still a top half performer on our team of ~34 reps. 
- Our customer base is still growing, but the product is bound to get outshined somewhere down the line. It looks like it is straight out of the 90s.

pros:
- if you have a good manager then you are a lucky one, as in any company.
- Some bonuses for job well done (not monthly)
- meal tickets
- Health insurance
- Oracle employees discounts for some stores/ fitness
- Free platforms to be able to learn
cons:
- salaries do not get raised very often and if they do very little (10% maximum in 2 years). some never did.
- The vacation days are not paid out only if you leave, in rest you are obligated to take them otherwise they get deleted.
- year end/ Christmas bonuses are applicable only for the countries which are obligated by law, in Romania they do not apply.
- the bonuses for job well done , are taxable so from the amount provided actually you receive less even though you have spent more as you need to provide receipts. 
- you do not have any other allowances other than the salary itself, only if you are upper management or you work with with other regions due to late working hours.
- you mainly do overtime to be able to get your tasks done, but if you submit overtime it is not very appreciated ("you are not well organized")even if you do the tasks in some cases for 2-3 people.
- Management prefers to hire people which are "Yes Mam" 
- Some Managers are known for Micro managing . 
- some employees are afraid to speak up due to managers action afterwards. even if it is a problem raised by the employees to the HR regarding a manager nobody acts upon the complains (even in exit forms).
- Nobody asks why people leave so frequently (less than 2 years) - also, nobody cares.
- Some Managers get promoted on the work of their directs or take responsibility as their own accomplishment even if they did not get implicated at all, sometimes even made it harder on their directs to manage that project (as not worthy)...while the directs..you guessed it, get nothing.
- in-house trainings made by people which have no people skills, or are true trainers.

cons:
Not much engagement between different functions, most people do not know or want to know about processes in other functions.

Oracle does not value existing employees, salary reviews happen very seldom. However, Oracle will not hesitate to pay a new recruit a lot more above what existing employees of many years make in the same role. So negotiate your package very well if you have a job offer because chances are you will not see any more money for the rest of your employment there.
